Row.Text: The Koa is a Polynesian Unique Unit. It is slightly stronger than the Swordsman it replaces, has the Amphibious promotion, and does not require Iron.
Amphibious melee unit of the Classical era that does not require Iron. Only Polynesia may build it.

Taking their name from the tree from which they crafted their diverse weaponry, the koa were feared above all other warriors in Hawaii. Their rigorous training, undertaken secretly in the night, honed their skills against enemy formations. Each sought mastery of Kapu Ku'ialua, often known simply as lua. Hawaii's indigenous martial art, lua focuses on joint locks, pressure points, and bone-shattering techniques, with an emphasis on strategy to compliment its role in oceanic warfare. Armed with this style, the koa fought with spears, staffs, slings, daggers, and hoe leiomano--an iconic shark-toothed weapon. In order to preserve the traditions of the koa, Kamehameha formed the pa ku'ialua--schools where young men continued to be trained in lua for decades after.
